c7440236a795.title: Your words made my heart swell.

paragraphs.text: Your words made my heart swell. Though I’ve experienced death of loved ones, forgetfulness is a whole other beast of tragedy, and I appreciate you sharing not only your memories, but also your transformation of perspective. How you were able to see yourself as not just a boy who lost his grandfather, but as a lieutenant with intel to share with his…
paragraphs.name: 2d86

37a8c427c7dc.title: My maternal grandfather passed away when I was little.

paragraphs.text: My maternal grandfather passed away when I was little. He has been such an important person in my life: he taught me my very first words (ironically enough, it wasn’t my father or mother), he cared for me, played with me when my parents were busy with my younger siblings, and he always encouraged me and lifted me up—he never, ever abandoned me or…
paragraphs.name: 3a43

virtuals.subtitle: But he had an extremely egregious habit—smoking. He would smoke every day, anytime, anywhere, even though we tried to talk him out of it…

content.subtitle: But he had an extremely egregious habit—smoking. He would smoke every day, anytime, anywhere, even though we tried to talk him out of it…

a9d6d4440621.title: Thank you for sharing this, it’s quite a well done, vivid piece!

paragraphs.text: Thank you for sharing this, it’s quite a well done, vivid piece! Every year on the anniversary of each of my parents’ passing, I write them a letter and share it with the world. I feel like it’s such a great way to honor them and all that they’ve brought to the world. It’s also a great way for me to continue healing and processing everything. I'm…
paragraphs.name: 903c

virtuals.subtitle: Your grandfather sounds like he was very imaginative and having that growing up is something to cherish lifelong in the form of memories…

content.subtitle: Your grandfather sounds like he was very imaginative and having that growing up is something to cherish lifelong in the form of memories…

daf748df0f78.title: Thanks for reading and for your kind words, Carolyn.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for reading and for your kind words, Carolyn. He was an amazing guy. An amazing grandfather. I am the lucky one, no doubt.
paragraphs.name: 6ba7

7d0af14a92da.title: Dan, what a powerful, poignant, wise piece honoring your grandfather.

paragraphs.text: Dan, what a powerful, poignant, wise piece honoring your grandfather. The fact that he played soldier with you in such a committed, earnest way — that he played with you at all, and enjoyed it — tells me so much about his delightful imagination, his love, and the pleasure he took just being with you. This is rare. He is a rare grandfather. You are…
paragraphs.name: 08e2

But to me, to that little too brainy girl, he is the…

cb7589545e5a.title: My grandmother is losing sight gradually.

paragraphs.text: My grandmother is losing sight gradually. One eye is gone, while the other is losing its visibility day by day. I can never fathom the pain and despair she goes through, everyday. Everytime I visit her, she gets elated. She thinks that this might be the last time she’ll be able to see​ me. She doesn’t want to die blind. And yet death is yet to call her home. Cruel world!!
paragraphs.name: 61a1

15ce4de0336b.title: Dan, what a beautiful tribute to your grandfather.

paragraphs.text: Dan, what a beautiful tribute to your grandfather. I loved every word and felt my heart open. I also have enjoyed reading others’ comments. I lost my father recently after 10 years of saying goodbye to him in stages. Dementia is cruel but it allows us time for these goodbyes and that helps. I remember the last time I saw him, telling him all that he…
paragraphs.name: fe8b

paragraphs.text: Wow, Dan that’s so beautiful. Exquisitely written and down-to-earthly simple and poignant, in a language that pulls at the heart strings. You did make quite a few people cry, and a lot of us went silent I daresay. As a new grandpa myself I’m inspired, looking forward to the days my granddaughter will grow up…Most of the times grown-ups, me included…
paragraphs.name: 292b

content.subtitle: Thank you for sharing your story.

96b57fa0e78.title: My grandfather told this story about how he inadvertently became General Patton’s scotch supplier…

paragraphs.text: My grandfather told this story about how he inadvertently became General Patton’s scotch supplier during the war. He and a friend commandeered a mortuary affairs truck and filled it to the brim with Johnny Walker Red. One evening, close to the end of the war, they’re in Germany hanging out at a makeshift Officer’s Club getting a little sloppy. A…
paragraphs.name: 4e60

virtuals.subtitle: “Hey boys, where can a fella get some of that Johnny Walker Red!?”

content.subtitle: “Hey boys, where can a fella get some of that Johnny Walker Red!?”

paragraphs.text: Oh, man. Thanks, Danny boy.

e66b5a7cdea5.title: You touched our hearts with great memories.

paragraphs.text: You touched our hearts with great memories. I posted this because I have a great grandfather that I never want to lose. Thank you, Soldier. Keep your heart safe !
paragraphs.name: d321

f6458b8f236c.title: Beautiful writing, Dan Moore Honoring parents, grandparents a lost art, and you’ve reminded us why…

paragraphs.text: Beautiful writing, Dan Moore Honoring parents, grandparents a lost art, and you’ve reminded us why it ought not be lost. Thanks again, Dan.
paragraphs.name: 227b

419dfd309ca.title: Randall Lewis, thank you for your kind words, and for sharing your tradition in honoring your…

paragraphs.text: Randall Lewis, thank you for your kind words, and for sharing your tradition in honoring your parents. You’re so, so right — writing about the memories DOES make them immortal. It makes them more tangible somehow, more real, things that you can hold and revisit and pass on. It’s at the heart of why I write, too.
paragraphs.name: fb75

paragraphs.text: Also, yes, my Grandpa was badass. Thanks again :)
paragraphs.name: cff9

virtuals.subtitle: Also, yes, my Grandpa was badass. Thanks again :)

content.subtitle: Also, yes, my Grandpa was badass. Thanks again :)

1f1b9c2acc3a.title: I feel like I am the little boy and the man and the grandfather all at once reading this.

paragraphs.text: I feel like I am the little boy and the man and the grandfather all at once reading this. The simplicity of the telling makes the impact all that much more powerful. Thank you for this painfully enjoyable moment.
paragraphs.name: f15f

198b044558d7.name: Dan Moore
198b044558d7.bio: Formerly a first grade teacher. Presently a freelance writer. Student of James Baldwin & Andre 3000. Dmoore4now@gmail.com

6e285b4a1878.name: emerald jane waters👗
6e285b4a1878.bio: Being light while trying to hold onto my wild mind--with two kinds of teenager and a soulful little dog. Flower painter. Cultural anthropologist. Portland.

8a40dffea8e2.name: Emma Crowe
8a40dffea8e2.bio: Studying a MA in Digital Experience Design at Hyper Island and based in Manchester. “Design beautiful in simplicity and intuitive in function.” — Me

ac021a47c8f1.name: Catherine T Davidson
ac021a47c8f1.bio: Writer, mother, teacher, proud immigrant. Born in LA, living in London. Connecting through the world of words one reader at a time.

61b755f65e65.name: Randall Lewis
61b755f65e65.bio: Electronic Musician, Multipotentialite, Neurotic Overthinker — Notorious for apologizing when others walk into him.

de0a580777cd.name: Ebru Oruç
de0a580777cd.bio: Teacher at Eti Social Sciences High School and published her poems in Radikal, Milliyet Blog and Sinada Magazine. Still writing essays, articles on education.

dc09c5c75dc5.name: Craig Heath
dc09c5c75dc5.bio: Happy husband, stepfather and corporate sell-out. My writing roots and experience go back 40 years. Starting over on the creative path after a 20-year hiatus.
